title: Liverpool footballer Luis Diaz back in training amid 'hope' for kidnapped dad
content: Liverpool forward Luis Diaz has resumed training days after his parents were kidnapped in Colombia.
contentSnippet: Liverpool forward Luis Diaz has resumed training days after his parents were kidnapped in Colombia.

title: What's Russia doing when the world is not looking?
content: As the world's attention turns to the Israel-Hamas war, Russia is ramping up its offensive in Ukraine.
contentSnippet: As the world's attention turns to the Israel-Hamas war, Russia is ramping up its offensive in Ukraine.

title: Hezbollah leader warns of possible escalation - and tells US 'your fleets will not scare us'
content: The leader of Lebanon's Hezbollah has warned of possible escalation as his militia engages in cross-border fighting with Israel.
contentSnippet: The leader of Lebanon's Hezbollah has warned of possible escalation as his militia engages in cross-border fighting with Israel.

title: Which countries are calling for a ceasefire – and how is it different to a humanitarian pause?
content: The UN has failed to adopt a unanimous resolution for a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas.
contentSnippet: The UN has failed to adopt a unanimous resolution for a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas.

title: King had chance to define vision for Commonwealth on Kenya visit - and it's being hailed a success
content: Even with four days there seemed a lot to do in Kenya. This was a moment for the King to define his vision for the Commonwealth.
contentSnippet: Even with four days there seemed a lot to do in Kenya. This was a moment for the King to define his vision for the Commonwealth.

title: A war between Israel and Hezbollah would be far more dangerous than current conflict
content: Concern is growing about the risk of the Iran-backed militant group Hezbollah in Lebanon declaring all-out war with Israel.
contentSnippet: Concern is growing about the risk of the Iran-backed militant group Hezbollah in Lebanon declaring all-out war with Israel.

title: Sam Bankman-Fried faces jail after he is found guilty of defrauding crypto customers out of billions
content: Sam Bankman-Fried has been found guilty of defrauding customers of his cryptocurrency exchange out of billions of dollars.
contentSnippet: Sam Bankman-Fried has been found guilty of defrauding customers of his cryptocurrency exchange out of billions of dollars.

title: Luis Diaz's dad will be freed 'as soon as possible', kidnappers say
content: The father of Liverpool footballer Luis Diaz, who was kidnapped in Colombia, will be freed "as soon as possible", according to a representative of the rebel group holding him.
contentSnippet: The father of Liverpool footballer Luis Diaz, who was kidnapped in Colombia, will be freed "as soon as possible", according to a representative of the rebel group holding him.

title: What social media videos and satellite images tell us about the number of dead in Gaza
content: Mass casualty airstrikes in Gaza have captured headlines around the world, but doubt has been cast on the reliability of fatality figures in the warzone.
contentSnippet: Mass casualty airstrikes in Gaza have captured headlines around the world, but doubt has been cast on the reliability of fatality figures in the warzone.

title: Briton tells Sky News of 'chaos' in leaving Gaza as he becomes among first to flee
content: One of the first Britons to escape Gaza has told Sky News of the "chaos" he faced while trying to escape - and his "heavy heart" for those left behind.
contentSnippet: One of the first Britons to escape Gaza has told Sky News of the "chaos" he faced while trying to escape - and his "heavy heart" for those left behind.

title: Ashling Murphy and Ireland's femicide epidemic
content: She was just going for a run.

title: Former politician shot in the face in Madrid
content: A former Catalan political leader has been shot in the face in Madrid.

title: Aid is getting into Gaza via the Israel-Egypt border - but it's stop-start, laborious and not enough
content: The Israeli military has invited a large contingent of media organisations, including Sky News, to the Nitzana border crossing in the Negev Desert.
contentSnippet: The Israeli military has invited a large contingent of media organisations, including Sky News, to the Nitzana border crossing in the Negev Desert.

title: Volcanic eruption under the sea creates new land mass - but expert warns island may not last long
content: A small new island was born off Japan's coast after an undersea volcano erupted three weeks ago - but it may not last long.
contentSnippet: A small new island was born off Japan's coast after an undersea volcano erupted three weeks ago - but it may not last long.

title: Man found guilty of murdering Irish teacher Ashling Murphy

title: Tens of thousands of civilians flee amid heavy fighting in Gaza
content: Tens of thousands of Palestinians are fleeing Gaza neighbourhoods where Israeli ground forces have been battling Hamas militants.

title: Who is Hamas leader that Israel claims to have trapped in a bunker?

title: Hollywood stars celebrate end of longest actors' strike in history
content: US actors' union SAG-AFTRA has agreed a "tentative deal" with Hollywood studio bosses to end a 118-day strike.
contentSnippet: US actors' union SAG-AFTRA has agreed a "tentative deal" with Hollywood studio bosses to end a 118-day strike.

title: Harrowing details of sieges emerge as thousands flee after army bases in Sudan captured
content: Three out of four army headquarters in each of Darfur's state capitals have fallen to the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in Sudan - pushing thousands of people further into peril.
contentSnippet: Three out of four army headquarters in each of Darfur's state capitals have fallen to the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in Sudan - pushing thousands of people further into peril.

title: Father of Liverpool star Luis Diaz freed by his captors
content: The father of Liverpool footballer Luis Diaz has been freed by his captors in Colombia - almost two weeks after being kidnapped.
contentSnippet: The father of Liverpool footballer Luis Diaz has been freed by his captors in Colombia - almost two weeks after being kidnapped.

title: Top football boss breaks ranks - and says FIFA is awarding World Cups without transparency
content: A world football boss has broken rank to claim FIFA is awarding World Cups - including to Saudi Arabia - without a transparent process.

title: Woman breaks record for biggest paddle-in wave ever surfed
content: An Australian surfer has broken the record for the biggest-ever paddle-in wave surfed by a woman.
